original_title: Sri Lanka bond yields up at open, rupee at 321.50/322.50 against the US dollar
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s bond yields opened down on Monday and the rupee opened at 321.50/322.50 against the US dollar, dealers said.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2025 was quoted at 28.30/29.00 percent, down from 28.75/29.25 percent from a day earlier.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 was quoted at 26.30/27.00 percent, down from 26.80/27.10 percent.
One-year bill was quoted at 26.30/27.00 percent steady from 26.30/26.80 percent at last closing.
The rupee opened at 321.50/322.50 to the US dollar in the spot market from 321.50/75. (Colombo/April24/2023)
